channel.title: The making of the Next MMORPG
channel.description:
INTRO
hi im "Hello to you all" ive been learning Java for about a year and a half now and since ive just heard of the new updates with Runescape that will basicailly destroy our RS cheating community of all our profits i have decided to start with a plan that i had about 4 months ago.
The End plan is to basically create our own MMORPG!
I have been in contact with a Expert Java scripter and explained what i am looking for and he advised me that firstly his services would cost alot of money and that alone it would take him too long.
I have also been in contact with a old member of the Jagex team who also has alot of experience working with java and he also reccomends the same thing.
First StepFinding the Right people for the Team. Basically I am looking for Everyone and Anyone on this Forum who Have alot of experience with Java, and who believe they have the knowledge to contribute to the making of the Next Big MMORPG.
Please post, pm me, msn or Email me if you think you can contribute to this team.
I will update this post in (1) week time

the client debugs it at 50

item.source: The making of the Next MMORPG

item.title: The making of the Next MMORPG
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

As stated earlier that C++ and C has quite some identical syntaxes with Java, not only these two does. Another programming language that looks even more like Java would be C#. C++ and C is made back-compatible, but when C# was created not too long ago (in the early 2000, and I don’t remember what exact year), they (Microsoft) took the advantages that Java, C and C++ had and made this language fully OO (Object Oriented).

C# does use something that Java doesn’t have, however. This feature is called properties. It can be made in Java with normal set and get methods, but doesn’t completely work like it. You could say it looks like you’re using methods and public modifiers both at once.

The below is not really on topic, nor in the correct section of the forums, but anyway (as an example).
Here is an example of such, using a class (Object) called AClass:

[code]private string aVariable;

public string MethodName
{
set
{
aVariable = value;
}

 get
 {
      return aVariable;
 }

}[/code]

How to use it:

[code]/** Using the get property. */
string aString = AClass.MethodName;

/** Using the set property. */
AClass.MethodName = aString;[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: The making of the Next MMORPG

why?
what would you suggest then?

c or c++ if you’re going 3d, using 3d graphics in java is currently VERY slow
[/quote]pretty sure runescape runs at 50fps

i thought it was 16[/quote]
Who really cares if you don’t notice it? If it does lag its probably your internet connection which c/c++ will be able to jack all about.

MMORPG + Java = fail.

why?
what would you suggest then?

c or c++ if you’re going 3d, using 3d graphics in java is currently VERY slow

Proof or gtfo.
[/quote]
two words: wurm online
i can run a lot of games released at good fps, but that game, with uglier graphics and such gives me lower fps.[/quote]

First of all, that is the only Java game in existance that has acceptable graphics.
Second off all, all its graphics are rendered with a Java plugin written in C++.

item.title: The making of the Next MMORPG
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“S!ms, post:10, topic:163886”][quote author=Stork link=topic=222604.msg1924014#msg1924014 date=1197325044]

MMORPG + Java = fail.

why?
what would you suggest then?

c or c++ if you’re going 3d, using 3d graphics in java is currently VERY slow

Proof or gtfo.
[/quote]

Runescape is Java, WoW is C++.[/quote]

Jagex is thick enough to build their own 3d libraries also. Java3D and JOGL are not that slow you know. If you would be a Java 3D game with a library that only works with 3D, then your game would be more successful.

[quote=“hello to you all, post:1, topic:163886”]INTRO

hi im “Hello to you all” ive been learning Java for about a year and a half now and since ive just heard of the new updates with Runescape that will basicailly destroy our RS cheating community of all our profits i have decided to start with a plan that i had about 4 months ago.

The End plan is to basically create our own MMORPG!

I have been in contact with a Expert Java scripter and explained what i am looking for and he advised me that firstly his services would cost alot of money and that alone it would take him too long.

I have also been in contact with a old member of the Jagex team who also has alot of experience working with java and he also reccomends the same thing.

First StepFinding the Right people for the Team.
Basically I am looking for Everyone and Anyone on this Forum who Have alot of experience with Java, and who believe they have the knowledge to contribute to the making of the Next Big MMORPG.

Please post, pm me, msn or Email me if you think you can contribute to this team.

I will update this post in (1) week time[/quote]

Do you have a reason to spend the next year developing a Multiplayer Online RPG, or did you just wake up and choose to make one? Another thing, how thought-through is this game?

Read full topic
